meanings.definition: Sensitive to cold or chilly weather.
meanings.sent1: She wore a thick coat because she was nesh and felt the cold easily.
meanings.sent2: The nesh kitten shivered in the snow.
meanings.sent3: The nesh puppy refused to go outside in the winter without a sweater.
meanings.sent4: The delicate flower wilted in the nesh breeze.
meanings.sent5: Her nesh skin turned pink in the chilly wind.

meanings.sent1: His nesh body couldn't handle the heavy lifting.
meanings.sent2: The nesh child needed extra care and attention.
meanings.sent3: The nesh fabric tore easily with a gentle tug.
meanings.sent4: The nesh bridge collapsed under the weight of the car.
meanings.sent5: Her nesh voice barely carried across the room.

meanings.sent1: His nesh stomach couldn't handle spicy food.
meanings.sent2: The nesh plant withered in the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The nesh car stalled in the slightest rain.
meanings.sent4: Her nesh mood brightened with a kind word.
meanings.sent5: The nesh fabric wrinkled at the slightest touch.
